content.prompt: The industrialization of Great Britainâ€™s economy in the mid-eighteenth and early nineteenth centuries is most directly explained by which of the following?

choices.label: Britain had large reserves of petroleum.

Britain had large reserves of coal.
British engineers developed new methods of producing cheaper steel.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
